I'm happy to help you understand the annual leave policy. Here's everything you need to know:

**Entitlements & Eligibility:**
- **Annual Leave Entitlement:** Employees are entitled to [X] days of paid vacation per year, based on their length of service with the company. 
- **Eligibility:** All full-time and part-time employees are eligible for vacation entitlements, provided they meet the minimum service requirement of [Y] months.
- **Carry Forward:** Unused vacation days do not carry over to the next year. Any unused leave must be taken before the end of the year.

**Complete Procedures:**
1. Submit a leave request form to HR at least [Z] days before your planned leave start date.
2. HR will review your request and notify you of approval or any additional information needed.
3. If approved, plan your leave accordingly, ensuring to coordinate with your team for coverage.

**Documentation Requirements:**
- No additional documents are required for standard annual leave requests.

**Timeframes & Deadlines:**
- Leave requests must be submitted at least [Z] days in advance.
- Unused leave must be taken before the end of the year.

**Important Considerations:**
- Frequent short absences may trigger a review.
- Unused leave at the end of the year must be taken before leaving the company.
- For special circumstances, please contact HR for guidance.

**Next Steps:**
1. Check your specific annual leave entitlement based on your service length.
2. Fill out the leave request form and submit it to HR.
3. Coordinate with your team for coverage if needed.
4. If you have any questions, reach out to your HR representative.

Hope this helps!
